name: Holbeck Ghyll Country House

reviews.title: Service
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed recently for 3 nights. Suffice to say this is a great hotel and the service is first class and the food is truly exceptional. Nothing was too much trouble and when my car got stuck in the bottom car park,they were out to help asap and used the hotels Land Rover to give me a quick tow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The views are superb. Just a couple of very minor things to improve a brilliant experience; the bed and pilows in the room were not that great (please supply a double mattress rather than two singles zipped together and thicker pillows)and the spa would be complete with a little pool.
reviews.title: Wonderful weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To be honest these are minor things and I would recommend this hotel to everyone and the food and service is to really,really top class.
reviews.title: 2 Heart Wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We agree with the other reviewers: excellent food, great location with great views over Lake Windermere and the mountains beyond, excellent staff both helpful and caring. I would add a few points. First, small hotels, even very good ones, have too few staff, often recruited from the local community and not fully trained. Here, by contrast, was a large international team, very well-trained, so everything worked very smoothly. Housekeeping was immaculate. The spa, although rather limited, basically a sauna and shower, nevertheless provided my partner and me with very good massages after a long day on the fells. Our bathroom was very nice: separate shower and bath, good towels and robes, and bathroom bits. Hot water bottles in the bed at night was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Glorious...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was excellent. Prompt service, nice amuses bouches, carefully selected and cooked food. There is long and varied wine list, with the hotel's special selections, which were not expensive by most standards. One of our wine choices was expensive, but not in perfect condition. The occasional bad bottle is an inevitability. My wine merchant puts it at 5% of all wines, but more for older wines. It was changed without fuss, and not charged.
reviews.title: Autumn break at Holbeck Ghyll

reviews.text: Returned here recently for a 2nd visit, with family for my mother’s birthday. We stayed over 1 night in the Madison House, which was very nice. We loved the open fire, nit it was shame that given the well fitted kitchen, cooker and microwave, there were no utensils at all. We know that this is not self-catering accommodation, but a plate to heat up a pie in the microwave and some cutlery to eat it with would have been expected.
reviews.title: Second Time - Okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had lunch and dinner, we were seated in the middle of the room, which was fine, except that every time a waiter walked behind me my chair was tapped, which I could live with a few times but almost cracked and though that I would definitely say something to the next person who walked behind me and tapped my chair.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel with fantastic views!

reviews.text: The dinner was good, but the cheese was poor – the trolley looks impressive enough, but the portions are poor and served really amateurishly.
reviews.title: Gourmet magic

reviews.text: Breakfast was good, shame that they no longer do the little tray of accompaniments with the porridge.
reviews.title: Just one word is necessary - Wow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We may return here again, but next time we’ll probably try somewhere else, shame it could not be as perfect this time as it was the first.
reviews.title: Restoring our faith

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my husband stayed for a 2 night break in october, we had a room in the main house with beautiful views over the lake. We found all staff to be pleasant and helpful at all times, the room was clean, comfortable and had a lovely modern bathroom. The food was absolutely fantastic, loved the pre dinner canapes, excellent wine selection and top quality locally sourced food. We were also lucky enough to have the use of the sauna and steam room to ourselves on both nights and loved the views over the fields and down to the lake from the relaxation area. All in all we had a wonderful time and I have since recommended to family and friends.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Room in Annex overlookig Lake Windermere
reviews.title: Superb !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was simply excellent .......... well cooked, well presented and just delicious.
reviews.title: Luxurious stay in fantastic surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Very good value Autumn break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Terrific Location overlooking the lake but away from Madding Crowds of Windermere and Ambleside.
reviews.title: Wonderful treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A fantastic hotel in glorious surroundings ideal for a romantic weekend away (from the kids!). The staff are exceptional attending to your every need and the friendlyand courteous professionalism, I am sure the hotel pridess itself on, is maintained throughout. Dining in the Michelin Star restaurant was a delight, probably the best meal I have ever eaten. The service was amazing never feeling hurried or left too long and the recommendations of the wine waiter will only add to he experience. Fantastic stay and would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Fantastic Country House Experience

reviews.text: Beautifully located overlooking Lake Windermere this Victorian shooting lodge provides a warm welcome and a restful place to stay. Rooms are well furnished and spacious with a slightly chintzy feel. Not everything worked eg the CD player was dead and the hairdryer intermittent. Most people will go for the Michelin starred food which reaches but doesn't exceed expectations. We found the service to be slow on occasions eg pre-dinner cocktail orders, waiting for wine to be poured (annoyingly even red wine is kept off the table) and slow breakfast service although they were very busy for the latter as everyone seemed to come down at once. Most frustrating was that we were told at 7.20pm that the tasting menu had already sold out for that evening (they can only do a maximum of 8 covers of that apparently). Moreover the waiter's manner in conveying this was somewhat brusque and not meaningfully apologetic. We were staying two nights and were looking forward to the tasting menu on the second night but no one had told us of the need to reserve. An excellent wine list and similarly drinks by the glass including sherries and fine malts.
reviews.title: Smart hotel, good food, small improvements could make a big difference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and the better half stayed at this hotel for my birthday weekend. The hotel has a beautiful view of Windermere. The rooms are pretty good (if a little dated) - we had a balcony view of the lake which was stunning.
reviews.title: The Restaurant is Amazing!

reviews.text: We ate at Claridges (amazing) the month prior to this weekend stay and I have to say the food here was just as good. The food quality, taste, choice is just superb. We ate there two nights in a row, trying the tasting menu and a la carte too. All of it was great. The wine list is (as you'd expect) very good and the chap making recomendations wasn't pretentious, which was good for a wine novice.
reviews.title: Classic country hotel
Never disappoints. 10/10
reviews.text: Stay here, but definitely eat here - very very good.

description: This luxurious country house hotel is set in seven acres of private woodland and gardens, in England's picturesque Lake District. Holbeck Ghyll offers 23 individually designed en-suite rooms, most with spectacular views over Lake Windermere. The Health Spa offers a range of treatments, sauna, steam room and gym equipment. Food is an integral part of any guests stay, and the Restaurant, which has retained a Michelin Star for seven consecutive years, will not disappoint.
